meanings.definition: The state of being unable to be reached or entered.
meanings.sent1: The inaccessibility of the mountain peak made it impossible for hikers to reach.
meanings.sent2: The inaccessibility of the building due to the locked doors frustrated the visitors.
meanings.sent3: The inaccessibility of the cookie jar led to a comical attempt to retrieve a treat.
meanings.sent4: Her inaccessibility to emotions made her seem like an enigma to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The inaccessibility of the treasure chest heightened the excitement of the adventure.

meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to obtain or use.
meanings.sent1: The inaccessibility of the rare gem made it highly sought after by collectors.
meanings.sent2: The inaccessibility of the information in the ancient text puzzled historians.
meanings.sent3: The inaccessibility of the secret recipe added to the mystique of the famous chef.
meanings.sent4: His inaccessibility to technology made him rely on traditional methods for communication.
meanings.sent5: The inaccessibility of the shortcut forced them to take the longer route home.
